business.headline: UBS upgrades stance on Indian equities, but says China 'more attractive'Despite India's promising fundamentals, China remains UBS's top pick among emerging markets (EM), thanks to cheaper valuations and a stronger risk-reward profile.
Sensex opens 175 points lower, Nifty below 24,300; IndusInd bank up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 159.23 points to 79,957.26, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 72.20 points to 24,256.75 as of 9:28 am.

ICAI to examine books of crisis-hit Gensol Engineering and BluSmartGensol Engineering and BluSmart are currently facing scrutiny after serious questions were raised about their financial dealings and governance practices.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to extend gains beyond 80,000?Sensex, Nifty expectation: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,415.5 at 8:01 am, up 0.3% from Wednesday's Nifty50 close of 24,328.95, signalling a higher opening.

Stocks to watch on April 24: HUL, Nestle, SBI Life, Axis Bank, Adani GreenShares of HUL, Axis Bank, Tech Mahindra, Nestle, Persistent Systems and SBI Life Insurance Company will be closely watched today as the companies are set to announce their fourth quarter earnings.

From watches to antiques, these luxury goods above Rs 10 lakh face 1% TCSThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued fresh guidelines to enforce the levy, which aims to plug tax leaks and boost visibility on big-ticket purchases.

'Operation Zeppelin' reveals details of Adani's counter to Hindenburg: ReportIn January 2023, Hindenburg published a scathing report against the Adani Group. The counter to its damning report against the conglomerate was dubbed 'Operation Zeppelin'.

European Union fines Apple $570 million, Meta $228 million under new tech lawsThe fines levied on the two American tech giants are likely to stoke tensions with US President Donald Trump, who has threatened to levy tariffs against countries that penalise US companies.

Looking for high FD rates? These banks offer interest of over 9%A few small finance banks are offering attractive interest rates, some as high as 9.10% for senior citizens. These banks are using competitive rates to draw in long-term deposits, making them a smart pick for cautious investors.
Sensex closes 520 points higher; Nifty above 24,300; HCLTech jumps 8%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 520.90 points to close at 80,116.49, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 161.50 points to end at 24,328.95.

Crude oil prices fall below $70, will you get fuel price relief soon?The last reduction in petrol and diesel prices was in March 2024, when prices were cut by Rs 2, just ahead of the general elections. Before that, prices remained unchanged for almost two years.

Ather Energy IPO: 5 key things to know before investingAther Energy's IPO will open for public subscription on Monday, April 28, 2025 and will close on April, 30, 2025, while anchor investors will get their allotment on April, 25.

entertainment.headline: Rohit Shetty confirms Simmba, Sooryavanshi sequelsFilmmaker Rohit Shetty recently confirmed that both Ranveer Singh's 'Simmba' and Akshay Kumar's 'Sooryavanshi' will have sequels.

Anurag Kashyap, Imtiaz Ali's daughters were in Pahalgam before terror attackAnurag Kashyap and Imtiaz Ali's daughters, Aaliyah and Ida were in Pahalgam, two days before the terror attack that took the lives of 26 people.

Kesari 2 box office Day 6: Akshay Kumar's film nears Rs 50 crore before 2nd weekendWhile Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' has kept a decent face at the box office so far, it will be challenged by new releases in theatres from this weekend. There's also 'Jaat', which has not gone out of the race yet. Will 'Kesari 2' be able to rise amid chaos at the ticket window and find its way ahead?

Terror coming from one place, ruining faith: Actor Ridhi Dogra on Pahalgam attackActor Ridhi Dogra, whose film 'Abir Gulaal' has been halted due to collaboration with Pakistani actor Fawad Khan, reacted to the Pahalgam terror attack. She wrote that terror is coming from one place, ruining faith and humanity.

Fawad Khan condemns Pahalgam attack amid Abir Gulaal ban by film federationActor Fawad Khan condemned the Pahalgam terror attack after the Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) announced a blanket ban on Pakistani artists. His film, 'Abir Gulaal', which was slated for release on May 9, has now been banned.

Shawn Mendes spotted with Portuguese singer MARO — Romance or music collab?Shawn Mendes and Portuguese artist MARO were seen enjoying a relaxed coffee date in Los Angeles, sparking rumors of romance or a possible collaboration as fans speculate about their easy chemistry and shared vibe.

Meet the New Haymitch: Zada and Peak join Hunger Games prequel castJoseph Zada and Whitney Peak will star in Hunger Games: Sunrise on the Reaping, a 2026 prequel exploring young Haymitch Abernathy's past during the 50th Games, directed by franchise veteran Francis Lawrence.

Harvey Weinstein back in court for rape retrial, faces new charges from former modelHarvey Weinstein's retrial began in New York with new and existing sexual assault allegations, including claims from Kaja Sokola. Prosecutors say Weinstein exploited power; his defense argues encounters were consensual.

2025 American Music Awards: Full List of nominees, host, and how to watchKendrick Lamar leads the 2025 American Music Awards with 10 nominations. Jennifer Lopez returns as host for the May 26 Las Vegas event, with Billie Eilish and Chappell Roan earning seven nods each.

Carlos Santana Postpones San Antonio Concert After Health Scare, Tour ContinuesCarlos Santana postponed his San Antonio concert after suffering dehydration before the show. The 76-year-old is recovering, with tour dates continuing as scheduled and a rescheduled date for San Antonio to be announced.

Will ensure Fawad Khan's Abir Gulaal isn't released in India: Film FederationIn response to the Pahalgam terror attack, FWICE has imposed a ban on Pakistani artistes, and is working to block the release of Abir Gulaal, a film featuring Fawad Khan in India.

CID to air a silent episode, Daya-Abhijeet call it a 'challenging experience'CID is set to air a special silent episode, offering viewers a unique experience as the investigative team faces a major challenge without dialogue.

Heads of State trailer: Priyanka, John Cena, Idris Alba get their guns blazingThe trailer of the action-packed comedy Heads of State, featuring Idris Elba, John Cena, and Priyanka Chopra Jonas, has been released ahead of its global premiere on Prime Video on July 2.

Tastefully Yours trailer: Netflix's next K-drama is classic enemies-to-lovers tale'Tastefully Yours', a highly anticipated K-drama starring Kang Ha-neul and Go Min-si, premieres on May 12, 2025. The romantic comedy promises culinary conflicts and a classic rivals-to-lovers plot.

Khauf review: A psychological horror where fear isn't just a feeling, it's a mirrorReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025'Khauf' is a psychological horror series that delves into the unsettling fears rooted in patriarchy and trauma, rather than relying on typical jump scares. Set in Delhi, it follows Madhuri's haunting journey as she navigates past traumas and eerie experiences in a women's hostel, offering a raw portrayal of real-world horrors and emotional terror.

Sonakshi Sinha backs TV show Meri Bhavya Life, talks about body positivityBollywood actor Sonakshi Sinha has joined the promotion of the TV show 'Meri Bhavya Life,' which challenges societal norms regarding body image. In a recent promo, she is seen discussing her experiences with body-shaming and urged young girls to embrace body positivity.

Wednesday 2 teaser: Jenna Ortega is back to create more madness and mayhemNetflix released the much-awaited teaser of 'Wednesday' Season two on April 23. Along with the season's first glimpse, the release dates were also announced, splitting it into two parts.

Carlos Santana hospitalised before Texas concert due to medical emergencyLegendary musician Carlos Santana was hospitalised in Texas due to a medical emergency before his concert. The incident, suspected to be dehydration, led to the postponement of his San Antonio show. Santana's team remains hopeful for a swift recovery as he plans to continue his U.S. tour.

Director Tejas remembers shooting Emraan Hashmi's 'Ground Zero' in BaramullaDirector Tejas Vijay Deoskar, in an interview with India Today Digital, shared his experience of shooting 'Ground Zero' in Baramulla, Kashmir. The film, starring Emraan Hashmi in the lead, will release in theatres on April 25.

general news.headline: Indus Waters Treaty paused, Attari border shut: India responds to J&K attackIndia has unleashed a sweeping diplomatic offensive on Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror strike by suspending Indus Waters Treaty, sealing Wagah border and shutting border checkpost.

India summons top Pakistan diplomat in Delhi after Pahalgam terror attackIndia's strong diplomatic retaliation following the brutal terrorist attack in Pahalgam, which left 26 people dead, including 25 Indians and one Nepali national, has triggered a political and strategic crisis in Pakistan, exposing its deepening isolation on the global stage.

Tears, silence, heartbreak as bodies of 26 Pahalgam victims return homeAt least 26 tourists were killed in Kashmir's Pahalgam on Tuesday after the terrorists confirmed their religious identities. Heartbreaking images of tourists' bodies being received by friends and families across India have now emerged.

I kill you: Team India coach Gautam Gambhir receives threat mail from 'ISIS'India head coach and ex-BJP MP Gautam Gambhir received a death threat via email. He has filed a police complaint, and the cyber cell is investigating to trace the sender.

India pauses Indus Waters Treaty: What next for Pakistan?From creating storage on the western rivers - Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab - to stopping the sharing of water flow data, the implications could be disastrous for Pakistan, which is heavily dependent on the Indus River System. Under such circumstances, what options do Pakistan really have? Find out
India will reduce tariffs, says Donald Trump amid ongoing trade talksDonald Trump, ahead of the upcoming trade talks, said he has received confirmation that India plans to reduce tariffs.

Best photo we got: JD Vance shares candid family moment at Taj MahalThe Vances dressed for the sweltering summer weather with effortless charm. JD Vance sported a navy blue blazer over a pale blue shirt and beige trousers, while Usha Vance opted for her signature simple elegance in a striped midi dress.

I began reciting Kalma: Assam man recalls encounter with terrorist in PahalgamDebasish Bhattacharyya, who was in Pahalgam with his family when a group of tourists were attacked on April 22, said a terrorist approached him during the attack.

Fawad Khan condemns Pahalgam attack amid Abir Gulaal ban by film federationActor Fawad Khan condemned the Pahalgam terror attack after the Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) announced a blanket ban on Pakistani artists. His film, 'Abir Gulaal', which was slated for release on May 9, has now been banned.

India puts Indus Waters Treaty on hold: What it signifiesIndia has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty following the Pahalgam terror attack, halting the supply of 39 billion cubic meters of water annually from rivers such as the Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab originating from Jammu and Kashmir.

India suspends visa exemption for Pakistani nationals: What is the scheme?The SAARC Visa Exemption Scheme (SVES) has been suspended by India following the Pahalgam terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

Trump tears into Zelenskyy for not ceding Crimea to Russia: Get it doneDonald Trump criticised Ukraine's Zelenskyy for rejecting Crimea concessions, accusing him of prolonging war efforts. Ahead of key London peace talks, Trump urged swift action, while Zelenskyy insisted on full Ukrainian sovereignty.

Michelle Obama on why she skipped Trump's inauguration: Hard thing for me to doMichelle Obama has finally addressed why she skipped Donald Trump's inauguration as the US President, revealing it wasn't due to marriage troubles. On her podcast, she said it was a personal decision to prioritise her well-being.

India's 5-pronged offensive against Pakistan after Pahalgam massacreIndia on Wednesday announced strong diplomatic measures against Pakistan, including the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty and no entry for Pakistani nationals to India, following the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives.

'If attacked by India...': Ex-Pak minister's post day after Pahalgam attackAs India vowed retaliation for the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, former Pakistani Minister Chaudhry Fawad Hussain called for national unity, urging all political factions to stand together to defend the country.

Come to office or you are fired: Google to some remote employeesGoogle is stepping up its return-to-office policy, asking certain remote employees to either report to the office or prepare to exit the company. This move comes as the tech giant continues to reduce costs while investing heavily in artificial intelligence.

Rohit Sharma joins Virat Kohli on mount 12k, goes past Kieron Pollard in MI listRohit Sharma's fine knock of 70 against SRH helped him to reach the landmark of 12,000 runs in T20s, joining Virat Kohli in the process. Rohit also went past Kieron Pollard in an elite list for MI on Wednesday, April 23.

ED raids 8 locations linked to FIITJEE in Delhi-NCR over closure of centresThe shutdown of hundreds of FIITJEE centres affected the academic future of nearly 12,000 students. Meanwhile, the institute's owners allegedly made a profit of around Rs 12 crore, sparking outrage among parents and students alike.

This is 56-inch chest: BJP MP's praise for PM after India's move against PakBJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Wednesday praised the government for putting the Indus Waters Treaty of 1960 on hold following the Pahalgam terror attack which killed 26 people.

Mumbai woman calls judges 'dog mafia', sentenced to one week of imprisonmentThe Bombay High Court sentenced the woman to one week of simple imprisonment for calling the judges of the High Court and Supreme Court a part of a "dog mafia".

From the India Today archives (2001) | War on Terrorism- Should India Attack, Powell and PatienceThe debate is on within the Government whether India should strike at terrorist training camps across the border.

Trump wants to keep Elon Musk for a 'long time' as billionaire cuts time at DOGEElon Musk, who has played a central role in the Trump administration's controversial drive to streamline the federal government, confirmed plans this week to reduce his government time commitment to just one or two days per week starting in May.

NIA opposes Tahawwur Rana's plea to speak to family, court to decide todayDelhi's Patiala House Court heard arguments from both the National Investigation Agency (NIA) and Tahawwur Rana's legal aid counsel on Wednesday and is expected to pronounce its order on the matter today.

India responds to Pahalgam attack, Pakistan faces global isolationIn a strongly worded statement issued late Wednesday evening, India announced the effective downgrading of diplomatic relations with Pakistan, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and the expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi.

sports.headline: Sachin Tendulkar turns 52: Raina, Harbhajan lead birthday wishes for India greatHappy Birthday, Sachin Tendulkar: The cricket fraternity took to social media on Thursday to extend birthday wishes to batting great Sachin Tendulkar on his 52nd birthday, April 24, 2025.

Tricky Chinnaswamy pitches no excuse for RCB's poor home run: Rajat PatidarRCB skipper Rajat Patidar has claimed that his side won't use the tricky Chinnaswamy pitches as an excuse for their poor home form in IPL 2025. RCB are yet to win a home game this season.

Rohit Sharma makes cricket look easy: Sehwag praises MI star's fiery 70 vs SRHVirender Sehwag praised Rohit Sharma's knock against SRH, saying the way he batted with calm and control made the game look easy. He felt Rohit's form lifts the entire team and helps others perform.

Pakistan's Nadeem snubs Neeraj Chopra Classic for Asian Athletics ChampionshipPakistan's javelin star and reigning Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem has decided to decline the invite to take part in the Neeraj Chopra classic event, which will take place in Bengaluru on May 24.

Rajat Patidar enjoying learning process as RCB skipper: Input from seniors helping meRajat Patidar has said that he is enjoying the learning process as RCB skipper and said the input from the senior players is helping him a lot. Patidar has made a good start to life as the RCB skipper.

Fairplay or brain fade? Ishan Kishan walks, gutted after replay shows no edgeIPL 2025, SRH vs MI: Ishan Kishan walked without waiting for the umpire's call, only to be gutted later as replays showed no edge on his dismissal on Wednesday in Hyderabad.

Pat Cummins, Hardik Pandya condemn Pahalgam attack, wear black armbands in IPL gameIPL 2025: Pat Cummins and Hardik Pandya offered their condolences to the families of the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack. The captains of the SunRisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians were wearing black armbands at the toss in Hyderabad on Wednesday, April 23.

SRH, MI stars observe one-minute silence to honour Pahalgam attack victimsIPL 2025: Before the SRH vs MI match in Hyderabad, the IPL honoured victims of the Pahalgam terror attack with silence, black armbands, and no celebrations, as the nation mourned the tragic loss of 26 lives.

SRH vs MI: Shami on impact subs list for Hyderabad, Mumbai make one changeSRH decided to drop Mohammed Shami to the impact subs list for their must-win clash against MI in Hyderabad on Wednesday, April 23. Mumbai made one change to their team for the clash.

KL Rahul's flexibility gives Delhi Capitals depth in IPL 2025: Shane WatsonShane Watson feels that KL Rahul's flexibility has given DC depth with the bat this season in the IPL 2025. Rahul was the star of the show as DC defeated LSG for a second time this season.

Zimbabwe end 7-year wait for away Test win in BangladeshZimbabwe broke a seven-year overseas drought in style, toppling Bangladesh in a gripping Test finish. The win marked just their fourth away Test triumph, echoing their last victory at the same venue in 2018.

CSK never presses panic button: Chennai CEO Kasi Viswanathan on IPL 2025 runChennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan has said that the franchise never presses the panic button despite their poor performances in the IPL 2025 season. CSK are currently in the final spot on the points table.

NBA: Jayson Tatum listed as doubtful for Game 2 vs Magic after wrist injuryThe Boston Celtics announced Tuesday, April 22, that All-Star forward Jayson Tatum is listed as doubtful for Game 2 of their first-round series against the Orlando Magic.

NBA: LeBron James responds to Kevin Gates over targeting wife SavannaThe NBA Playoffs heated up off the court when rapper Kevin Gates made controversial remarks about LeBron James' wife, Savannah James. This sparked major backlash and a direct response from the Los Angeles Lakers superstar.

Rajasthan Royals complain to state government against match fixing allegationsIndian Premier League (IPL) franchise Rajasthan Royals (RR) have complained to the Rajasthan government against the match fixing allegations put on them by Jaideep Bihani, the convenor of Rajasthan Cricket Association (RCA).

Mohammad Shami's 'All Eyes On Pahalgam' post to condemn terrorist attackFast bowler Mohammed Shami condemned the terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam in a strongly-worded post on social media. Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar were among the several Indian sportspersons who condemned the terror attack.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
